translated: Itivuttaka
The Collection of Threes
The Second Chapter
Craving (Second)

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā rāgo appahīno, doso appahīno, moho appahīno—
analyzed: yassa kassaci bhikkhave bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā rāgaḥ appahīnaḥ dosaḥ appahīnaḥ mohaḥ appahīnaḥ
translated: “Monks, for any monk or nun in whom passion is unabandoned, in whom aversion is unabandoned, in whom delusion is unabandoned,

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘atiṇṇo samuddaṁ saūmiṁ savīciṁ sāvaṭṭaṁ sagahaṁ sarakkhasaṁ’.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave atiṇṇaḥ samuddam sa ūmim sa vīcim sa avaṭṭam sa gaham sa rakkhasa
translated: they are said to have not crossed the ocean with its breakers, sharks, & demons, the waters of which are reddened by the blood of those who have drowned.

original: Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā rāgo pahīno, doso pahīno, moho pahīno—
analyzed: yassa kassaci bhikkhave bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā rāgaḥ pahīnaḥ dosaḥ pahīnaḥ mohaḥ pahīnaḥ
translated: But for any monk or nun in whom passion is abandoned, in whom aversion is abandoned, in whom delusion is abandoned,

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ‘atari samuddaṁ saūmiṁ savīciṁ sāvaṭṭaṁ sagahaṁ sarakkhasaṁ, tiṇṇo pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo’”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave atari samuddam sa ūmim sa vīcim sa avaṭṭam sa gaham sa rakkhasa pāraṅgataḥ thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇaḥ ti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: they are said to have crossed the ocean with its breakers, sharks, & demons, the waters of which are reddened by the blood of those who have drowned. Having crossed over, they stand on firm ground, on higher ground, a brahman.”🔽The Blessed One said this.
And in connection with this, it was said:
“For one in whom passion, aversion,
and ignorance have faded away,

analyzed: somam samuddam sa gaham sa rakkhasa
translated: the ocean with its breakers, sharks, & demons,🔽its waters reddened by the blood of those who have drowned—
is crossed, with its terrors left behind.

analyzed: saṅga atigaḥ maccu jahaḥ nirūpadhi  pahāsi dukkham apunabbhavāya
translated: He has gone beyond the battlefield, has abandoned death, is without acquisitions,🔽Has given up suffering, and will not be born again.
He has attained final nibbāna, and his measure cannot be known.
He has freed himself from the king of death, I say.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what the Buddha said. Thus have I heard:
The tenth.🔽The second section.
The summary:

original: Puññaṁ cakkhu atha indriyāni,🔽Addhā ca caritaṁ duve soci;
analyzed: puññam cakkhu atha indriyāni  addhā ca caritam duve soci
translated: Merit, eye, and faculties,🔽And two on the one who goes on the path;

analyzed: munaḥ atha rāga duve 🔽puna vaggam āhu
translated: The sage, and two on passion,
